reviews.text: Very peaceful and interesting place to learn about a key figure that shaped Chinese culture. It is well worth having a wander around these beautiful gardens and taking it all in.
One of my favorite places to visit in Beijing. Easy to get to by subway. Beautiful place to stroll and learn history.
The temple is around the corner of 雍和宮. If you are keen to explore somewhere off the tourist path this is where you could visit.

Beautiful ancient temple, so inspirational and full of history, one of the most beautiful temples in Beijing and while China. Long queues for tickets , better to visit in early morning, leads crowded )) near the Lama Temple
Nice environment, good to see and read about the ancient historic scholars. Worth a visit if you have the time. Not difficult to get there by train and walk with GPS. Also near the Lama Temple.
Love the place, great food. I recommend the noodles with peanut sauce for sure and all dim sum was great overall.

It's too busy... They won't give you the attention the focus your looking for. 

I was disappointed.
Loved the Xiao long bao (plain pork) ! Very delicious, especially the chocolate ones, which I highly recommend!

The place that could never be wrong when you're in a delicacy hunger. Their services staff are at least 4 levels/types and the food is typical Cantonese cuisine. The crab one is a can't miss, seasonal seafood is a nice surprise.

Great place for Chinese dumplings and other dishes. The restaurant is on the expensive side as for Chinese pricing but it is well worth it. The management speaks English also so it is easy to communicate. Menu's are clear and with pictures so you can also pick and choose what to eat. Great for both locals and foreigners.
Had one of the best Chinese food experience here. Amazing location to have lunch/dinner with your colleagues or friends. Do try their soups/rice noodles. Awesome food !!

The chili pork special is very good here. It's a very old restaurant cum bar, probably among the first in Kolkata in that area. A nice and cosy place. Some Tables have partition so nice for group privacy. Chinese food is extremely tasty. It tastes very refined. The staff are courteous and the drinks menu is extensive. On the scale of 1 to 5 value for money I would give it 4 stars.

I visited Jimmy's Kitchen after 25 years and went with high expectations from my earlier visits. While the decor has remained the same and the service was still good the food itself was disappointing. It seems to have lost the authentic Chinese flavour it is famous for.

The Chilli chicken didn't feel fresh and tasted rather plain too. Didn't feel like ordering anything after that. Alcohol was overpriced considering the sub-par ambience. No cocktails were available even though listed on the menu. And the only ice cream being served was vanilla, again other flavors were on the list though not being served.
The dry chilly chicken is awesome! Limited option on cocktails. Drinks are pretty cheap. Nice place to hang out for drinks...

Do not miss the Museum of Contemporary Art in Bangkok! Not only is it a wonderful museum it is also a stunning piece of modern architecture. You'll need all day and then some more, a dream for any art buff there's five floors of spectacular exhibits. On the ground floor there's a restaurant, garden and an interactive experience. Take the family.  I loved it and next time I'm in Bangkok I'll be heading back for another look.👍🌟🌟🌟🌟🌟

The Museum of Contemporary Art is from 2012. It is a private museum housed in a large building. 

There is no double pricing. Same price for a Thai and a foreigner. If you  are more than 60, you can enter for free. Not only Thais, but also foreigners. The price for a regular ticket is TB 250.

Obviously, most of the items on display in this museum are from Thailand, but on the fifth floor there is an interesting collection of foreign items.

Next to all items on display is a label with information in Thai and in English. 

You are allowed to use a camera inside the museum, but you cannot use a flash. There is one exception: you are not allowed to take pictures inside the special Robert Green collection on the fifth floor.

There is a coffee shop on the ground floor. There is a car park in the basement. 

The staff are friendly and helpful.

If you are interested in contemporary art, this place is definitely worth a visit.

Oh....
This is an ....hard to say.
They declare that this is a contemporary museum but this museum does not explore the comprehensive contemporary art all over the world because it’s simply this is a private museum owned by one business man.the collection is rely on his taste.of course this museum is playing a key role for collecting national artists of Thailand but mainly the collection is reflected on his preference.
I really love this spot because I can enjoy the most sophisticated art works in Bangkok.
I’ll come back here again.

Great museum. 
Beautiful building. Lots of great surrealism and some traditional Thai art. 
Definitely worth going although it's hard to get to, since the nearby train is not operational yet. Try to make sure your cab driver knows the place. Took us some time to get there but was worth it 👍👍

Surprisingly beautiful (and modern) structure that houses mostly modern and some traditional art. Peacefully quiet—not many locals seem aware it exists. The art is fascinating—a modern reinterpreting traditional Thai aesthetic forms. Lovely reprieve from the hot chaos of the city.

Lovely night to spend with family and friends.  The side dishes were prepared to perfection--especially the sweet potatoes.  Biggest concern---my steak was way over cooked.  Ordered it medium rare....warm red center and it came out well done.  Not even a sign of pink.  This shouldn't happen at a top notch steak house.
Wait staff was awesome and food was superb. It’s tradition for us to find a Ruth Chris where ever we travel too. This one did not disappoint! Wonderful experience.

Totally overrated.  Ate here last night with a group of ten. Had the petite filet.  Said to the waiter that I wanted it cooked medium rare plus and then said maybe it should be medium.  He told me that it cooks very fast and I should order it medium rare.  I said okay and chose to have it cooked without butter.  I like to taste the meat.  You can put butter on feathers and it will taste great.  I guess that when they cook it and add the butter it makes the meat taste better than it really is.  So out comes our dinner and my steak is RARE and not even close to medium rare.   I ate a few bites because I was really hungry and I noticed it had a lot of pepper on it.  I finally flagged down our waiter and showed him the steak.  He agreed that it was rare and offered to bring me a hot plate, whatever good that would do, or take it back and cook it some more, which would probably dry the steak.  Since most of our party was well along in the meal, I opted to finish my steak, which by the way was not that good.  Maybe I should have had the butter.  I have had better meat from Costco prime steaks.  What a waste of money!

Consistency fantastic, the food is always delicious and the steak us done to perfection. 
We shared a large rib eye steak, medium rare, a mouth watering experience. The salads were fantastic as well- my wife enjoyed the Wedge and I loved the arugula salad.
The service is always top notch,  and our waiter Alex was attentive, friendly and made it a very pleasant evening. The martinis were great, and the cheesecake dessert with the salted caramel was devine. Obviously we will back!

Dined with family and friends and was not disappointed. The choice of steak and extensive side dishes was excellent. All our steaks were cooked as ordered and would recommend this restaurant to steak lovers visiting Waikiki. A little on the pricey side for a steak house but well worth it.
